events.name: Damage to Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant
events.wd_label: Damage to Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant
events.wd_description: The Ukrainian nuclear agency reported that part of the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, controlled by Russia, was damaged by Russian rockets, though no radiation leak is suspected.
events.description: The Ukrainian nuclear agency reported that part of the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, controlled by Russia, was damaged by Russian rockets, though no radiation leak is suspected.

events.name: Enerhoatom report
events.wd_description: Enerhoatom reported that a nitrogen-oxygen unit and a high-voltage power line at the Zaporizhzhia plant were damaged by Russian rockets.
events.description: Enerhoatom reported that a nitrogen-oxygen unit and a high-voltage power line at the Zaporizhzhia plant were damaged by Russian rockets.

events.name: Russian and Ukrainian blame
events.wd_description: Russian-appointed local officials blamed Ukraine for shelling, while Ukraine blamed Russian forces for launching rockets at civilian areas from the plant site.
events.description: Russian-appointed local officials blamed Ukraine for shelling, while Ukraine blamed Russian forces for launching rockets at civilian areas from the plant site.

events.name: plant control and operations
events.wd_description: Russia seized the Zaporizhzhia plant in March but kept Ukrainian employees to continue operations; the plant consists of six pressurized water reactors and stores radioactive waste.
events.description: Russia seized the Zaporizhzhia plant in March but kept Ukrainian employees to continue operations; the plant consists of six pressurized water reactors and stores radioactive waste.

events.name: UK defense ministry statement
events.wd_description: The UK's defense ministry stated that Russia has used the area around the Zaporizhzhia plant to minimize the risk of attack by Ukrainian forces due to its protected status.
events.description: The UK's defense ministry stated that Russia has used the area around the Zaporizhzhia plant to minimize the risk of attack by Ukrainian forces due to its protected status.

events.name: UN nuclear disarmament meeting fails due to Russia's refusal
events.wd_label: UN nuclear disarmament meeting fails due to Russia's refusal
events.wd_description: A UN meeting on nuclear disarmament failed after Russia refused to accept the final draft of the treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons, aimed at reducing nuclear risks and stopping the expansion of nuclear arsenals.
events.description: A UN meeting on nuclear disarmament failed after Russia refused to accept the final draft of the treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons, aimed at reducing nuclear risks and stopping the expansion of nuclear arsenals.

events.name: meeting failure
events.wd_description: The UN meeting on nuclear disarmament failed after Russia refused to accept the final draft of the treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons.
events.description: The UN meeting on nuclear disarmament failed after Russia refused to accept the final draft of the treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons.

events.name: treaty review
events.wd_description: The treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons is reviewed every five years as part of efforts to reduce nuclear risks and stop the expansion of nuclear arsenals.
events.description: The treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons is reviewed every five years as part of efforts to reduce nuclear risks and stop the expansion of nuclear arsenals.

events.name: Russia's attempts to amend treaty
events.wd_description: UN Ambassador Gustavo Zlauvinen stated that Russia attempted to amend the treaty, which would have caused chaos at this late stage in the negotiations.
events.description: UN Ambassador Gustavo Zlauvinen stated that Russia attempted to amend the treaty, which would have caused chaos at this late stage in the negotiations.

events.name: reactions to the failure
events.wd_description: Beatrice Fihn, the group's Executive Director, criticized the failure, stating that it is a total abdication of responsibility and noting that nuclear-armed states have spent over $82 billion on maintaining their arsenals without making progress on disarmament.
events.description: Beatrice Fihn, the group's Executive Director, criticized the failure, stating that it is a total abdication of responsibility and noting that nuclear-armed states have spent over $82 billion on maintaining their arsenals without making progress on disarmament.

events.name: Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin to meet at SCO summit
events.wd_label: Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin to meet at SCO summit
events.wd_description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin will meet on the sidelines of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) summit in Uzbekistan next week, marking their first face-to-face meeting since Russia invaded Ukraine.
events.description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin will meet on the sidelines of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) summit in Uzbekistan next week, marking their first face-to-face meeting since Russia invaded Ukraine.

events.name: announcement by Russian envoy
events.wd_description: Russian Envoy to Beijing, Andrey Desinov, announced that Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin will meet at the SCO summit in Uzbekistan.
events.description: Russian Envoy to Beijing, Andrey Desinov, announced that Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin will meet at the SCO summit in Uzbekistan.

events.name: significance of the meeting
events.wd_description: The expected meeting will be the first face-to-face encounter between Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin since Russia invaded Ukraine.
events.description: The expected meeting will be the first face-to-face encounter between Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin since Russia invaded Ukraine.

events.name: Xi Jinping's first overseas trip since the pandemic
events.wd_label: Xi Jinping's first overseas trip since the pandemic
events.wd_description: This trip will be Xi Jinping's first overseas trip since the early days of the pandemic and comes just weeks before a major political meeting in Beijing.
events.description: This trip will be Xi Jinping's first overseas trip since the early days of the pandemic and comes just weeks before a major political meeting in Beijing.

events.name: importance of Russia-China relationship
events.wd_description: The scheduled meeting and the choice of destination for Xi's first overseas trip signal the importance of the Russia-China relationship, despite international backlash against Moscow since the Ukraine war.
events.description: The scheduled meeting and the choice of destination for Xi's first overseas trip signal the importance of the Russia-China relationship, despite international backlash against Moscow since the Ukraine war.

events.name: CATL Announces New Battery Factory in Hungary
events.wd_label: CATL Announces New Battery Factory in Hungary
events.wd_description: On August 12, 2022, CATL announced the construction of a new battery factory in Debrecen, Hungary, with a planned capacity of 100GWh and an investment of 7.34 billion euros. This is CATL's second factory in Europe, following the German plant.
events.description: On August 12, 2022, CATL announced the construction of a new battery factory in Debrecen, Hungary, with a planned capacity of 100GWh and an investment of 7.34 billion euros. This is CATL's second factory in Europe, following the German plant.

events.name: Project Announcement
events.wd_description: The new battery factory will be built in Debrecen's southern industrial park, covering 221 hectares, to produce battery cells and modules for European automakers.
events.description: The new battery factory will be built in Debrecen's southern industrial park, covering 221 hectares, to produce battery cells and modules for European automakers.

events.name: Strategic Location
events.wd_description: Debrecen is centrally located in Europe, close to major automakers like Mercedes-Benz, BMW, Stellantis, and Volkswagen, facilitating CATL's response to European market demands.
events.description: Debrecen is centrally located in Europe, close to major automakers like Mercedes-Benz, BMW, Stellantis, and Volkswagen, facilitating CATL's response to European market demands.

events.name: Sustainability Initiatives
events.wd_description: CATL commits to reducing the carbon footprint of battery manufacturing by using renewable energy and exploring solar projects with local partners, as well as potential collaborations to establish battery material factories for a sustainable value chain.
events.description: CATL commits to reducing the carbon footprint of battery manufacturing by using renewable energy and exploring solar projects with local partners, as well as potential collaborations to establish battery material factories for a sustainable value chain.

events.name: Renewable Energy Usage
events.wd_description: The factory will use a significant amount of renewable energy to minimize its carbon footprint.
events.description: The factory will use a significant amount of renewable energy to minimize its carbon footprint.

events.name: Solar Project Development
events.wd_description: CATL will explore the development of solar projects with local partners in Hungary.
events.description: CATL will explore the development of solar projects with local partners in Hungary.

events.name: Battery Material Factory Exploration
events.wd_description: CATL is considering establishing battery material factories with local partners to promote a sustainable battery value chain.
events.description: CATL is considering establishing battery material factories with local partners to promote a sustainable battery value chain.

events.name: Local and Industry Reactions
events.wd_description: The factory has been praised by European customers and local officials, emphasizing its importance for regional economic growth and the EV industry's development.
events.description: The factory has been praised by European customers and local officials, emphasizing its importance for regional economic growth and the EV industry's development.

events.name: Hungarian Government Support
events.wd_description: Hungarian officials, including Foreign Minister Péter Szijjártó, highlighted the investment's significance for Hungary's economic growth and its position as a leading battery manufacturing center.
events.description: Hungarian officials, including Foreign Minister Péter Szijjártó, highlighted the investment's significance for Hungary's economic growth and its position as a leading battery manufacturing center.

events.name: Industry Praise
events.wd_description: Industry leaders like Markus Schäfer from Mercedes-Benz praised the factory for its role in expanding EV production and meeting carbon-neutral standards.
events.description: Industry leaders like Markus Schäfer from Mercedes-Benz praised the factory for its role in expanding EV production and meeting carbon-neutral standards.
